text: In an infant with adrenal failure and complete 46,XY sex reversal (SRXY3; 612965), Achermann et al. (2002)reported a homozygous G-to-A transition in exon 4 of the NR5A1 gene, which resulted in an arg92-to-gln (R92Q) amino acid change. This mutation altered a highly conserved residue of the A box, a region that functions as a secondary DNA binding domain. Three relatives of the infant (parents and a sister) were phenotypically normal despite being heterozygous for the mutation. In functional assays, the R92Q mutant exhibited partial loss of DNA binding and transcriptional activity when compared with the G35E P-box change (184757.0001), consistent with its phenotypic expression only when transmitted as a homozygous trait
